body.header: Complete the sentences by filling each gap with the correct word or phrase.

ol.li: A is someone who has been awarded a first degree.
A university building that has rooms for students to live in is called a .
An MA is an example of a .
A is a sum of money given to students by the state to cover their living expenses while they are studying at a college or university.
An is someone who is studying for a first degree.
The place where university students sit in rows of seats and listen to formal talks by university teachers giving information about the subject they are studying is called a .
The land that belongs to a university and where all the main buildings are situated is known as a .
A is a sum of money given to a student by a school, college, university or other organization, usually awarded on the basis of academic achievement, to help pay for a course of study.
A is someone who holds the lowest teaching rank at a university.
A is someone who is studying or doing research for a master's or doctoral degree.
A is a university teacher who supervises the studies of a single student or a small group of students.
A BA is an example of a .
A is someone who holds the highest teaching rank at a university.
Universities and colleges charges for their courses.
A is a qualification awarded by a university or college which is not as high as a degree.
A room containing scientific equipment where teaching, experiments and research are carried out is called a .
